      • getSortOrder

        public int getSortOrder()
        Description copied from interface: OrderTotalIf
        The sort order defines the order in which the order total items are added to the order. ot_total should be last since it adds up all of the other order totals to calculate the total of the order.
        Specified by:

      • getTax

        public java.math.BigDecimal getTax()
        Description copied from interface: OrderTotalIf
        In some cases an OrderTotal can modify the tax calculated for an order. This is the case when a promotion is applied to the total of the order before tax. In this case the amount of tax for the order needs to be reduced since it is calculated on the total of the order minus the discount.
        Specified by:
        getTax in interface OrderTotalIf
        Returns:
        the tax

      • setTax

        public void setTax(java.math.BigDecimal tax)
        Description copied from interface: OrderTotalIf
        In some cases an OrderTotal can modify the tax calculated for an order. This is the case when a promotion is applied to the total of the order before tax. In this case the amount of tax for the order needs to be reduced since it is calculated on the total of the order minus the discount.
        Specified by:
        setTax in interface OrderTotalIf
        Parameters:
        tax - the tax to set

      • getDiscountAmount

        public java.math.BigDecimal getDiscountAmount()
        Description copied from interface: OrderTotalIf
        The discount amount defined by the promotion. This will be null unless the order total contains the results of a promotion and the promotion defines a discount amount rather than a discount percentage.
        Specified by:
        getDiscountAmount in interface OrderTotalIf
        Returns:
        the discountAmount
